User.title: User
User.description: Represents a user profile in the application.

displayName.description: The display name of the user.

email.description: The email address of the user.

photoURL.description: URL of the user's profile photo.

bio.description: A short biography or description of the user.

createdAt.description: Timestamp indicating when the user account was created.

privacyDefault.description: Default privacy setting for the user's trips ('private', 'public', or 'friends').

Trip.title: Trip
Trip.description: Represents a travel trip logged by a user.

ownerId.description: Reference to the User who owns this trip. (Relationship: User 1:N Trip)

startDate.description: The start date of the trip.

endDate.description: The end date of the trip.

coverPhoto.description: URL of the cover photo for the trip.

createdAt.description: Timestamp indicating when the trip was created.

visibility.description: The visibility setting of the trip ('private', 'public', or 'shared').

sharedWith.description: An array of User IDs that this trip is shared with. (Relationship: User N:N Trip)

Entry.title: Entry
Entry.description: Represents a single entry or journal entry within a trip.

tripId.description: Reference to the Trip this entry belongs to. (Relationship: Trip 1:N Entry)

content.description: The content of the entry (rich text or markdown).

locationName.description: The location name for the entry.

locationLat.description: The latitude of the location for the entry.

locationLng.description: The longitude of the location for the entry.

media.description: An array of URLs or storage paths to media files associated with the entry.

createdAt.description: Timestamp indicating when the entry was created.

visitedAt.description: Timestamp indicating when the location was visited.

Route.title: Route
Route.description: Represents the route taken during a trip.

tripId.description: Reference to the Trip this route belongs to. (Relationship: Trip 1:N Route)

points.description: An array of latitude, longitude, and timestamp points representing the route.

distanceMeters.description: The distance of the route in meters.

polyline.description: An encoded polyline representation of the route.

Comment.title: Comment
Comment.description: Represents a comment on a specific trip entry.

entryId.description: Reference to the Entry this comment belongs to. (Relationship: Entry 1:N Comment)

authorId.description: Reference to the User who wrote the comment. (Relationship: User 1:N Comment)

text.description: The text content of the comment.

createdAt.description: Timestamp indicating when the comment was created.

definition.description: Stores user profiles. Only the authenticated user can read/write their own profile.

params.name: userId
params.description: The unique identifier of the user (auth.uid).

definition.description: Stores trip information. Users can read public trips, their own trips, or trips shared with them. They can only write to trips they own.

params.name: tripId
params.description: The unique identifier of the trip.

definition.description: Stores trip entries. Authorization is based on the parent trip's ownership and visibility.

params.name: tripId
params.description: The unique identifier of the trip.

params.name: entryId
params.description: The unique identifier of the entry.

definition.description: Stores route data associated with a specific trip.

params.name: routeId
params.description: The unique identifier of the route.

definition.description: Stores comments on trip entries. Allows querying comments across entries and trips.

params.name: commentId
params.description: The unique identifier of the comment.

firestore.reasoning:
The Firestore structure is designed to ensure authorization independence, clarity, and scalability for the WanderLust application. We leverage a top-level 'trips' collection to simplify queries for public, shared, and owned trips. The core entities (Users, Trips, Entries, Routes, and Comments) are organized in a way that mirrors their relationships while optimizing for security and query performance.

*   **/users/{userId}**: Stores user profiles. Security rules will ensure that only the authenticated user can read and write their own profile.
*   **/trips/{tripId}**: This top-level collection stores all trip documents. This structure is efficient for querying across all trips (e.g., for the public explore page). Security rules will manage access: a user can read a document if `visibility == 'public'`, if `ownerId == request.auth.uid`, or if their `uid` is in the `sharedWith` array. Write access is restricted to the trip owner.
*   **/trips/{tripId}/entries/{entryId}**: This continues the ownership pattern, with entries nested under trips. Security rules will be based on the parent trip's ownership and visibility settings, requiring a `get()` call to the parent trip document to check for read access. This is a standard and secure pattern for nested data. Write access to entries is limited to the trip owner or users the trip is shared with.
*   **/routes/{routeId}**: Stores route data in a top-level collection. Route documents include a `tripId` field. This segregation allows routes to be queried independently if needed while security rules will check the referenced trip's ownership to grant access.
*   **/comments/{commentId}**: Stores comments on entries in a top-level collection. The comment document includes an `entryId` and `tripId`. This structure simplifies querying comments and allows security rules to check the parent trip's visibility for read access.
